rComments: I thought I would fail this statistic class as math is always hard for me. But somehow I understand everything she said and her lecture slides put online are also clear enough for one missing class (wouldn't do much if you skipped too much).

It was clear that she was learning the material with us and often made mistakes when giving examples. This wasn't really a problem though because of the effort she put into the class. She was very sensitive to the fact that Soc majors aren't usually amazing at math. Everything was explained as though we were 12, which was actually really helpful.

Although she gives a quiz like once every 4 weeks, she is a decent prof, who's definitely an eye candy to look at. Although she is sometimes go thru the lecture slides fast, she has every lecture up on ecommons for our convenience.

Rachel is an amazing teacher. In the American Family writing class we had 5 essays and a powerpoint. The last three essays are about the same topic as your powerpoint and help build up on your research paper. She encourages participation in class and there will be a lot of debate on family issues.
Very vague when it comes to what she is looking for in your paper, she is an exteremly harsh grader, it's hard to imporve your writing when the feedback she gives is unclear.

I loved Rachel for Sexuality in Societies. The class was small (30ish people) and really interesting. Rachel picked a lot of interesting clips for the class to watch that were entertaining as well as pertinent to the course. Discussions were interesting and fun but not always super relevant. The text was amazing. A must take if it's offered!

Extremely vague  when it comes to what she wants to see in your research paper. I feel like I didn't learn anything for research methods. The TAs help you more then she does. Extremely tough grader and boring lecturer.
I liked Rachel. She was really nice and helpful. You have to do a lot of assignments, but they're easy and take like 10 minutes. She's a tough essay grader, but it's not hard to pass them.

She was a nice lady but she had super high expectations. When I say this, i mean she gave out a lot of HW which wasn't what bugged me, but she wouldn't allow no late work which was ridiculous considering the amount of work she assigned. She was pretty hard on grading and gave good feedback but required a lot of group work and a lot of participation

Dr. Bryant-Anderson was tough on grading and had high expectations.  But if you do the readings and utilize the HW to reflect critically, you'll learn a lot and she'll guide you through it but you need to be specific and ask a lot of questions.

Rachel was tough on essays, reading is always required for debates in class. She is friendly and approachable! I recieved C+/C and B-/C+ on most of my essays and thought my grade would be a C but she gave me a B! I participated a lot throughout class, asking questions, debating and just engaging with her teaching. She also helped me pass the AWPE.

Really nice teacher, she knows her stuff. Totally approachable, I wish she had come to SJSU sooner so I could have taken more classes with her. She is a great teacher, and if you want to have fun while learning I would suggest taking this teacher. Totally recommend!

she's very nice and gives pretty good feedback on essays.  doesnt assign too much hw or give too many pop quizzes either. her voice is monotone and the class is really boring. if you go to her shes willing to help.  & respects if you do not wish to participate in class, she doesnt randomly call on people. overall, it was a decent writing class.

Rachel is a very nice teacher and very helpful, but she does indeed talk in a monotone. Longest class ever. She also doesn't really seem to teach us anything; she just uses the text and comes up with a bunch of questions to ask us. She's a good teacher, average i'd say.. however, not very inspiring. And yes she does grade pretty hard on essays.

Extremely hard grader. Cannot improve scores on papers and reading responses even though she specifically stated that we could at the beginning of the course. I came to class, did all the readings, worked hard on the papers but my grade proved otherwise.

So BORING! she talk in monotone. She talks way too much and her class drags on forever. She's just some hipster that looked at some magazine cut outs for her dissertation. Not university of california material.

Extremely tough grader. I worked hard on the reading responses and essay, but the grades/points I received show otherwise.~Made me feel hopeless to improve in the class. Cannot redo reading responses even though she said that we can in the beginning. Overall, interesting class but rediculous grading system. Take advantage of the extra credit!

Excellent teacher. Gives really helpful feedback on papers. If you take the time to write out, and ask for advice, she will take tons of time generated useful feedback. Keep up with the reading because they will be helpful for writing your essays. I got an A in the class. It was not hard, but you do have to put in effort.

Rachel puts a ton of effort into her students and really wants you to do well. She is friendly, personable, and very helpful.  I got an A- and this class wasn't too difficult. Good, fun class and Rachel is awesome!

I went to her office hours and she told me exactly what to change, but when i turned it in she docked me off on the exact parts she said to change...She's a nice teacher, but a little harsh on grading. Got a B when the class is supposed to be an easy A...
